intro: Boechera pulchra var. gracilis, commonly known as the slender rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants known for their small, cross-shaped flowers. This variety is characterized by its slender stems and small, pinnately divided leaves. It typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. The plant produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
